alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 2:19PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Hot Springs County through 300 PM MDT... At 218 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Anchor Dam, or 32 miles south of Meeteetse, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Hot Springs County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this slow-moving storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Absaroka Mountains; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains
